---
title: "is_package_here"
---
<br>

```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
    collapse = TRUE,
    comment = ">"
)
```

```{r setup}
library(saferDev)
```
<br>

### Datasets
```{r}
req.pkg <- "ggplot2"
path <- "blablabla"
```
<br>

### Datasets info
```{r}
req.pkg # Character vector of package names
path # character vector specifying the absolute pathways of the directories, this lib.path will return an error
```
<br>

### Argument req.package
```{r, echo = TRUE, error = TRUE}
is_package_here(req.package = req.pkg) # check if the package serpentine is in the computer
```
<br>

### Argument lib.path
```{r, echo = TRUE, error = TRUE}
is_package_here(
    req.package = req.pkg,
    lib.path = "."
    ) # check if the package is in the computer
```
<br>

### Argument safer_check
```{r, echo = TRUE, error = TRUE}
is_package_here(
    req.package = req.pkg,
    safer_check = TRUE
    ) # check if the package is in the computer, safer_check = TRUE, checkings are performed before main code running 
```
<br>

### All the arguments
```{r, echo = TRUE, error = TRUE}
is_package_here(
    req.package = req.pkg,
    lib.path = path,
    safer_check = TRUE
    ) # check if the package is in the computer
```
```
